alert.note: Alert for Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:55AM EST until January 10 at 2:37PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey, including the following counties, Burlington, Camden, Gloucester and Mercer and southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks, Chester, Delaware, Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - For Chester Creek at Chester: At 12:32am the stage was 12.49 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. For Wissahickon Creek at Fort Washington: At 12:30am the stage was 12.59 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. For Perkiomen Creek at Graterford: At 12:46am the stage was 13.17 feet. Flood Stage is 11 feet. For Neshaminy Creek at Langhorne: At 12:15am the stage was 11.8 feet. Flood Stage is 9 feet. For Assunpink Creek at Mercerville: At 12:45am the stage was 9.93 feet. Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. For Schuylkill River at Norristown: At 12:30am the stage was 14.9 feet. Flood Stage is 13 feet. For Crum Creek at Newtown Square: At 11:45pm the stage was 9.68 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. For Neshaminy Creek at Penns Park: At 12:30am the stage was 18.0 feet. Flood Stage is 13 feet. For Wissahickon Creek at Wissahickon: At 12:00am the stage was 6.52 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. For Pennypack Creek at Pennypack: At 12:45am the stage was 10.1 feet. Flood Stage is 7 feet. For Ridley Creek at Media: At 12:30am the stage was 9.68 feet. Flood Stage is 7 feet. For East Branch Perkiomen at Schwenksville: At 12:15am the stage was 9.36 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
